page.title: 04SELSEY BILL BIRDS
page.content: Many{seabirds}fly past Selsey Bill. Some birds get blown off course,that's when we see unusual ones like{serin and{nightingale.}A seabird called the {skua}is the most famous rare visitor; it has black wings and tail.{Eider {ducks}come more often than they used to.Once there were 12-20 a year,now there are 180-190.They rest on the Mixon rocks. About 150-160 different sorts of birds come every year. Selsey has no bird observatory,because most birds fly through by way of the Isle of Wight.The best time to see{migrant birds is in late spring and mid- autumn.There are more to be observed in early morning to about 11 o'clock. Birds come to Selsey Bill because of the large fields and feeding areas,and because the Bill juts out into the Channel.These include{songbirds, {warblers}and{house martins.
